meta_description: The National Gallery of Canada is home to one of the finest collections of Indigenous and Canadian art in the world, and is dedicated to amplifying voices through art.
hours_text:
__ **Parking Rate Notice:** Effective Monday November 17, 2025, the daily maximum parking rate will increase to $21.

# Hours

Planning a visit? The Gallery is open Tuesday to Sunday from 9:30 a.m. to 5 p.m., September through May. For an extra-special experience, join us on Thursday evenings (open until 8 p.m.) for free admission, art activities and tours!

Gallery ❘ Boutique ❘ Dining ❘ Library and Archives

  * December 22 (Winter Break). Open from 9:30 a.m. – 5:00 p.m. 
  * December 24 (Christmas Eve). Open from 9:30 a.m. – 2:00 p.m. 
  * December 26 (Boxing Day). Open from 9:30 a.m. – 5:00 p.m. 
  * December 29 (Winter Break). Open from 9:30 a.m. – 5:00 p.m. 
  * January 1, 2026 (New Year's Day). Open from 12:00 p.m. – 8:00 p.m. 
  * February 16, 2026 (Ontario Family Day). Open from 9:30 a.m. – 5:00 p.m. 
  * March 2, 2026 (Quebec March Break). Open from 9:30 a.m. – 5:00 p.m. 
  * March 16, 2026 (Ontario March Break). Open from 9:30 a.m. – 5:00 p.m. 

**Closed**

  * December 25 (Christmas Day)
  * January 20 – 23, 2026 (Annual Maintenance)

## Boutique

The Boutique operates with the same hours as the Gallery.

accessibility_text:
__ **Parking Rate Notice:** Effective Monday November 17, 2025, the daily maximum parking rate will increase to $21.

# Accessibility

Art is for everyone. Since we’re all different, we understand that you may have specific needs, and we’ll do our best to meet them.

Here is a brief list of some of our programs and services. If you don’t find what you need below, please don't hesitate to contact Visitor Services at 613-990-1985 or [[email protected]](/web/20251112203639/https://www.gallery.ca/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection#1d74737b725d7a7c7171786f64337e7c) ​

## Accessibility Plan

This plan is about accessibility at the National Gallery of Canada. We want to be more accessible to people with disabilities. This plan is part of the Accessible Canada Act (ACA). The ACA is a new law that will help make all of Canada more accessible for people with disabilities.

[Learn More](http://web.archive.org/web/20251112203639/https://www.gallery.ca/about-the-gallery/ngc-accessibility-plan-2023-2025)

### Tours

Adapted tours introduce visitors with disabilities to the Gallery and its collections using [sensory based strategies](http://web.archive.org/web/20251112203639/https://www.gallery.ca/learn/for-schools/school-programs#relaxed_tours). Registration is required three weeks in advance for some activities. 

[SPARK!](http://web.archive.org/web/20251112203639/https://www.gallery.ca/learn/wellbeing-and-community-programs/spark) is a program designed for individuals living with dementia, and t...
